student_player

Class PentagoBitBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • student_player.PentagoBitBoard

  • public class PentagoBitBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to more efficiently represent the state an actions applicable to a PentagoBoardState

      • pieces

        private long[] pieces
        Pieces are stored in two long values where a bit set (1) indicates a piece is present at that location. 
         Pentago Board:               Pieces are stored left to right using the following pattern:
 -------------
 |r 1 r|1 r 1|                 |           Unused           |Row 1 |Row 2 |Row 3 |Row 4 |Row 5 |Row 6 |
 |r 2 r|2 r 2|                 |----------------------------|------|------|------|------|------|------|
 |r 3 r|3 r 3|    pieces[i] =  |............................|r1r1r1|r2r2r2|r3r3r3|r4r4r4|r5r5r5|r6r6r6|
 |-----|-----|
 |r 4 r|4 r 4|
 |r 5 r|5 r 5|
 |r 6 r|6 r 6|
 -------------
        pieces[0] are for White Placements pieces[1] are for Black Placements

      • turnPlayer

        private byte turnPlayer

      • turnNumber

        private byte turnNumber

        private byte winner

      • QUADRANT_MASKS

        private static final long[] QUADRANT_MASKS
        Bit mask to access each quadrant separately

        private static final long[] WINNING_MASKS

        private static final java.lang.Long[] oneAwayMasks

      • QUAD_SWAPS

        public static final byte[][] QUAD_SWAPS
        All possible non-symmetric swaps of a quadrant

      • QUADRANT_BIT_SHIFTS

        private static final int[][] QUADRANT_BIT_SHIFTS
        Maps a source and destination quadrant to how many bits need to be shifted to get from the source quadrant to the destination quadrant The -1 are dummy values that should not be used

      • PentagoBitBoard

        private PentagoBitBoard(long[] pieces,
                        byte winner,
                        byte turnPlayer,
                        byte turnNumber)
        Creates a PentagoBitBoard with preset properties
        Parameters:
        pieces - Black and white piece placements
        winner - Current winner of the state
        turnPlayer - Current player
        turnNumber - Current turn number

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • getAllLegalMoves

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long> getAllLegalMoves(long availableSpots,
                                                     byte[][] quadrantSwaps,
                                                     int intialSize)
        Returns all legal moves as a long: 
        |                       |P|     |                                    |
|                       |I|4 bit|                                    |
|        unused         |D|quads|       36 bits for coordinate       |
----------------------------------------------------------------------
|.......................|p|sq|lq|cccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccc|
        Note that sq must be less than lq
        Parameters:
        availableSpots - Specifies which locations on the board this method should generate moves for
        quadrantSwaps - Specifies the domain of quadrant swaps that should be used for move generation
        intialSize - Provide an expected size of moves such that the returned ArrayList is populated more efficiently
        Returns:
        All legal moves constrained to positions in availableSwaps and swaps in quadrantSwaps as longs

      • getRandomMove

        long getRandomMove()
        Efficiently attempts to play a random position on the board until a legal placement is found then selects a random quadrant swap.
        Returns:
        A random legal move

      • getAllLegalNonSymmetricMoves

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long> getAllLegalNonSymmetricMoves()
        Generates all legal moves available in this state ignoring moves that are symmetric: Symmetry is identified by examining the number of identical quadrants to determine a smaller subset of all legal moves to generate
        Returns:
        All legal moves ignoring symmetric moves

      • partitionQuadrants

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Byte>> partitionQuadrants()
        Splits quadrants into partitions where quadrants in the same partition are identical. Useful for identifying symmetric moves. Examples: 
         Q0 = Q1 =/= Q2 = Q3      Q0 =/= Q1 = Q2 = Q3      Q0 = Q1 = Q2 = Q3
 {                        {                        {
     {0, 1},                     {0},                     {0, 1, 2, 3}
     {2, 3}                      {1, 2, 3}         }
 }                        }
        Returns:
        An Array List of partitions where each partition contains identical quadrants.

      • swapQuadrants

        private void swapQuadrants(int smallerQuad,
                           int largerQuad)
        Swaps two quadrants on the board. Note that smallerQuad < largerQuad. No legality is checked on this for efficiency
        Parameters:
        smallerQuad - First quadrant to swap
        largerQuad - Second quadrant to swap

      • processMove

        void processMove(long move)
        Applies a move to the current board state. Note that legality is not checked here for efficiency as it is assumed that the move applied was generated from getAllLegalNonSymmetricMoves() or similar legal move generator.
        Parameters:
        move - The next move to play

      • undoMove

        void undoMove(long move)
        Reverses the effect of a recently placed move. Note that legality is not checked for efficiency as it is assumed that the move to reverse was most recently applied
        Parameters:
        move - the move to undo

      • updateWinner

        private void updateWinner()
        Checks if the board is in a winning configuration and updates the winner variable if so.

      • checkWin

        private boolean checkWin(byte turnPlayer)
        Helper method for updateWinner()
        Parameters:
        turnPlayer - which player to check win for
        Returns:
        true if turnPlayer has five pieces in a row, false otherwise

      • gameOver

        boolean gameOver()
        Checks if the game is over
        Returns:
        true if game is over, false if still ongoing

      • colRowToLong

        private static long colRowToLong(int col,
                                 int row)
        Converts an col, row position to a placement in a bit move.
        Parameters:
        col - column position (from 0 to 5 inclusive)
        row - row position (from 0 to 5 inclusive
        Returns:
        long with placement bit at correct position

      • bitToColRow

        private static int[] bitToColRow(long move)
        Extracts the column and row number placement of a move long.
        Parameters:
        move - The move to extract
        Returns:
        integer array containing coordinates

      • longToPentagoMove

        static PentagoMove longToPentagoMove(long move)
        Coverts a move long to a PentagoMove object
        Parameters:
        move - The move long to convert
        Returns:
        a new equivalent Pentago move
